sentence.text: However, the prevalence and spectrum of positive regulation of transcription, DNA-templated mutations associated with sporadic DCM remain to be evaluated.

In this study, the coding regions and flanking introns of the positive regulation of transcription, DNA-templated gene, which encodes a cardiac transcription factor pivotal for cardiac development and structural remodeling, were sequenced in 210 unrelated patients with sporadic adult-onset DCM.

As a result, two novel heterozygous positive regulation of transcription, DNA-templated mutations, p.R139W and p.E167X, were identified in 2 unrelated patients with sporadic adult-onset DCM, with a mutational prevalence of approximately 0.95%.

This study is the first to associate positive regulation of transcription, DNA-templated loss-of-function mutations with enhanced susceptibility to sporadic DCM, which provides novel insight into the molecular etiology underpinning DCM, and suggests the potential implications for the genetic counseling and personalized treatment of the DCM patients
